intro: Miconia diegogomezii, commonly known as the Diegogomezii miconia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Melastomataceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly found in humid lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows as an understory shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
